website_summaries.verdict: A durable hand gripper that you can adjust to suit your strength level.
pros: Durable hand gripper that comes with a lifetime warranty
Adjustable settings from 55 pounds to 154 pounds
cons: Some users have found the grip to be too smooth and slippery

website_summaries.verdict: The Death Grip works silently and effectively to strengthen hands and forearms.
pros: This is a really sturdy, adjustable grip strengthener
Feels solidly made, with high-quality materials
Provides between 55 and 154 pounds of pressure
cons: Some people prefer a stickier or more rubberized-type grip

customer_reviews.title: Slick plastic group
customer_reviews.text: I had high expectations for this gripper. My old gripper was too easy so I was looking forward to the high strength spring on this one. However the plastic handle is too slick and it shifts around in my hand as I try to exercise. My current gripper has a rubbery handle that works great. I wish this one did too so I could better know how it works.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.TX

customer_reviews.title: If you are tired of broken springs this is the ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of broken springs this is the way to go. I only wish the grip was a bit larger.
customer_reviews.author: ISHARRIS

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The grip is too smooth allowing it to slid around in your hand making it uncomfortable to use. The one I had before (which only went to 88lbs) had a high-density rubber on the grips which helped keep it where you wanted it to be in your hand. Maybe some friction tape will solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart J.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but there's a problem...
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised. It seems to be well made. There is one issue that I didn't see mentioned. The problem has to do with the way the increasing resistance is designed. It adjusts from 55 to 154lbs, which is great. However, as you increase the tension the handles actually get further and further apart. For an individual with larger hands, this won't be an issue, but it causes problems for me. Even though I can comfortably close the handles at higher settings, I can't get a full grip on the handle and have to re-adjust mid close. It's not a deal breaker, but it's definitely worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Even at minimum setting, requires a strong grip
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife and she was unable to use it for it was not possible to reduce the grip strength required at the beginning of training. The price is quite high. We then bought a unit from a different, well known manufacturer at less than half the price and it is far superior in that it has a counter for the number of compressions and the range of difficulty that one can set is much greater than the MummyFit's. Also, the competing unit has a distinct click when one has reached the limit of compression. Overall, for those, already with really good grip strength is is not a bad product but way overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great product, low profile so you can keep it in your pocket for impromptu grip training!
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite toy! I originally started with this oneThen I quickly moved up. I greatly prefer this one because of the black color and its much lower profile. This grip trainer is not as wide as the others so it easily fits in a back pocket of a pair of pants so you can grip train anywhere(and is great for stress relief), its adjustable(you can adjust it with your grip training hand without using your other hand or setting it down BIG PLUS)
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Seems to be very strong. The only complaint is the strength gradations appear to be imprecise, you're just turning the knob and trying to align the middle of the spring rod with the marks. Also, the instructions say that to find your maximum strength, select a strength level that will allow you to squeeze it just once, then add 11 lbs. Does this mean that the actual strength is 11 lbs over the indicated markings? Still, it's a good product, just choose a level that will allow you to get a good work out.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Flanders

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been lifting for 60 years and own almost $1000.00 worth of machine and grippers just for hand strength. This product is very comfortable unlike the round handled spring grippers. I used it today for the first time...it is calibrated to just about what I lift on my other plate resistance grip machines. I got a great work out and I am very enthusiastic about this product. It's a terrific way to strengthen your weak hand and is a definite advantage in that regard. You can take it with you !
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Stronger grip strenght is linked to longer life
customer_reviews.text: Read a study on how they used grip strenght to test mortality. The stronger your grip as you get older, the longer you live. Of course there are so many confounding variables, but it doesn't hurt to have this around. This gets blood to hands really easily. Great for stress relief as well. You can definitely build some, but not at all, muscles of your forearm. It is built to last and feels like it too. Use it daily for a bit, but it is in no way a substitute for actual resistance training.
customer_reviews.author: JustAGuy

customer_reviews.title: If Thor had a gym membership
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for sure. These grips go from easy breezy to dang near impossible. I’ve used pre set resistance in the past and purchased higher ones once I got acclimated to the weaker ones, but to be able to just turn a dial and have that in one product is amazing. I been unscrewing lids and opening potato chip bags like a champ lately. In fact just the other day, I saw a sweet old lady trying to open a bag of salt and vinnies. I just charged right over and gave that bag a tear, then boom I was like a GOD. Even got some digits from sweet old Janice if she ever needs any more services.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! I knew someone would have an adjustable hand grip (amazon was the answer). The grip looks and feels very well made. I am very happy and don't mind the somewhat pricey 30$ price tag. One and really only, major con- the grips really should have some type of grip tape or a slim rubber cushion. The hard plastic isn't very comfortable and can be a bit slippery when gripping the higher tensions. I honestly can't believe none suggested this when they made it. Otherwise, great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Basically perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It's seriously built like a tank and will give a serious workout. It's much more challenging than other grip strengtheners out on the market and will allow this to work for a long time. Operation is also completely silent unlike those squeaky springs in other competitors. The only criticism is the handles can get a bit slippery if your hand sweats. Some foam or more rigid plastic inserts would be nice, but this hasn't ruined the experience with it. I use it everyday and it works perfectly. I highly recommend this to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: S.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Device, Terrible Branding
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grip strengthener. I had previously used an IronMind gripper, which were great but the resistance is static. So, after a few months, I would need to buy another. The range of resistance on the MummyFit is sufficiently wide that I can use this to warm up as well as develop strength. The branding is awful ("Mummyfit" on one side and"Deathgrip" on the other). It is not end of the world, and I was able to cover it up a little with a sharpie, but the designers of this are shooting themselves in the foot with this stupid branding.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: You will see results from casual training!
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten stronger within the two weeks of ownership. I do not even do it very often, maybe once or twice every other day, while I'm at work I'll pick it up if I'm not too busy. Up from 70lbs to 100lbs, doing the same amount of reps and timed grip holds. If I manage to get to the max resistance within a couple months, I feel bad for anyone who has to shake my hand! Haha
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after awhile but getting a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I barely used the product for about 2 weeks or so but after awhile, I picked it back up and all the adjustments are stuck. Short/WIde knob doesn't move at all, and neither is the resistance adjustment. I reached out to MummyFit and immediately they told me that some units in the past had that issue and that they would send out a replacement. Will update if there are any problems with the replacement, but the product was great when it worked and I really appreciate the great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: High quality, durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a huge improvement over the cheap "22-88lb" grip strength trainer that there are a bunch of on Amazon. The spring on this MummyFit one is way more rugged and the nylon handle is comfortable. This one goes legitimately from 55lb to 154lbs. Make sure you hold it near your fingertips so you are properly building grip strength. This thing is seriously high quality. Use it every other day and you'll have beastly forearms and laugh at the guys at the gym that use straps for deadlifting.
customer_reviews.author: Ralk

customer_reviews.title: Solid... but could be more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality piece of equipment. I like that it’s adjustable for resistance. The plastic grips I don’t enjoy... I’ve preferred other models that have dense foam around the handles. This plastic is just not as comfortable in your hand and makes it shift a bit while you are exercising with it. Foam handles and this would be 5+ stars. Hands down.
customer_reviews.author: DAS

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It's OK but is a little small for me. It fits comfortable but does not have enough range of movement. It would be nice to be able to adjust it wider. The force also seems to be higher as it is fully squeezed. It is quiet as they say. I tried some other cheap ones in the store and they were noisey.
customer_reviews.author: ken ziesemer

customer_reviews.title: and here I thought I wouldn't be able to squeeze 50lbs
customer_reviews.text: A little more even distribution of stress than the old style with coil & handles, more stable in the hand too (but I see why they sell GripTape). I like the adjustable resistance as I anticipate having a Death Grip in short time. It has a steel hinge-pin holding a plastic hinge - hope that holds up.
customer_reviews.author: L. E. L.

customer_reviews.title: A definite improvement over the original style
customer_reviews.text: A definite improvement over the old style springs. This design actually works to incorporate all of the fingers in the workout, down to the "pinky;" whereas the older design didn't seem to really work that last two fingers, especially the "pinky". The finger grooves and adjustability now elevate this piece of equipment into a truly functional component of an exercise program for those seeking to increase finger strength.
customer_reviews.author: David James

customer_reviews.title: Met all my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using my new MummyFit DeathGrip for about a week now. It’s quiet, easy to set the grip strength, and gives my hands & forearms a great workout. I do have one complaint though, the fit-n-finish from the molding process is terrible. There is a raised line of plastic that runs around the perimeter of the griper. It’s raised just high enough to pinch the skin and by the time my workout is completed, the inside of my fingers & thumb are sore. It analogous to a blister forming. I’m going to take a series of emery boards to file down and smooth these ridges out. This is something MummyFit should address with the manufacturer for future production runs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great gripper equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item 3 weeks ago and I started using this today. The lightest resistance is good enough for those who haven't exercised at all or someone who stopped for a long time. It is better to start light to avoid possible injuries. Doing the warm-up alone is challenging enough for my weak muscles and this really surprised me. I've used grippers in the past and broke my last one several months ago. This made me decide to look for a better one and I believe I found it! I am looking forward to doing the exercises in the coming days and weeks. Thanks Amazon for the prompt delivery and thanks to the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel G.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of this grip. I have a very large hand and am able to squeeze it better than the smaller grips. It shows Kg on one side, and Lbs on the other, something my other grips don't display. Very easy to adjust. It is made of plastic, but it doesn't hurt my hand.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeTech

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool that it adjusts well. The problems I have with it is that it does not extend far enough out so I do not feel I get a full rep but I have long fingers. The other problem is there’s no cushioning this hard plastic it really hurts your hand I’ll try putting some tape on it.
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Grip Strengthener!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grip strengthener. Strong and durable. The last one I had broke after using it for about three weeks. Not that I'm super strong, just that I needed a grip strengthener that was versatile enough that would give me different levels of strength. I reached the limit on the old one. This one is certainly tough and durable. I'm going to get my money's worth out of it. I recommend it very highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best product of the price on amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the most impressed I've ever been of any product I've ever bought! I know that sounds fantastical and like I'm blowing hot air but seriously lol! This thing is crazy well designed, built and the adjustability is amazing! I bought a set of heavy weight steel grippers thinking that this wouldn't be enough resistance but yea...waste of money, I'll be working for a few months to close this at its highest resistance and I'm 6'7" 285lbs. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good grip builder
customer_reviews.text: Good grip builder for me due to med hand size. Adjust it to the "S" -- strong -- range and it is pretty tough to squeeze. Large-sized hands may find the range of motion limited. The "V" shape ofi t works the weak pinky finger very well. Overall, very good grip builder for small-medium hand size people.
customer_reviews.author: Serobi56

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. In the past I've used a gripper where you added springs to increase resistance, but you had to hook and space them properly to get a smooth pull when exercising your hands. The Mummy Fit is simple to use. Resistance is able to be increased in manageable increments by turning the built in dial on this gripper. I have been using it for over a month and my grip strength has improved faster than I expected. I'm looking forward to continuing improvement in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie G.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful resistance
customer_reviews.text: Unlike cheaper competing products, this grip strengthener can give extremely high resistance levels. This is extremely useful if you're doing something like deadlifting hundreds of pounds and need to improve your ability to hold that. My only complaint is that the grip itself is smooth and easily slips in your hand, and this problem becomes more pronounced the higher the resistance is. You might want to buy some grip tape and place it on the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Jerebear

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Knockoff!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT ACTUAL MUMMY FIT BRAND, was sold a cheap chinese knock off. I know because I ordered and actual one before. This unit came without a logo. Its construction is loose and wobbly, the plastic stamping is warped. Tension adjuster is not fully functional. SCAM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product overall, except for one small problem!
customer_reviews.text: I like this grip strengthener, it's made better than many on the market. the finish is great, it feels solid, but I have one grip, and that is what is pictured. The part that houses the spring is too small, and each time you close it, it rubs on the resistance spring. As you can see in the photo, the paint on the spring is being rubbed off after doing reps on this for only 2 days. Other than that, it's very smooth, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Matic

customer_reviews.title: Really Will Last Forever and a Day.
customer_reviews.text: I've had other grip strengtheners and this one is by far the best. I'm able to put my largish fingers into it and plug away without noticing after a while. I notice no real difference from when I first received this item. I believe it's the only one I'll ever need, and likely will end up being something handed down.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Awesomeness

customer_reviews.title: Very tough
customer_reviews.text: Very tough grip strength Has multiple adjustments Use the pin in the middle of the spring to see what pounds or kilograms to set the adjustment to
customer_reviews.author: jayson

customer_reviews.title: Great stiffness for workout.
customer_reviews.text: Other grip strengtheners I used didn't have enough resistance. This one is adjustable to an incredible amount of resistance. It is comfortable too. I have purchased 3 other kinds of grip strengtheners and this one is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 star with simple change
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. Great adjustable range. It is a little slippery on the fingers. Only one issue and the 4 star reason is because the adjustment is very easy to turn. So easy that if you do 50 reps the adjuster loosens about 3/4 of a turn on it's own. If it had a clicker type adjuster or an o-ring of some sort to keep it from loosening it would be 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: brian nichols

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very cool grip strengthener. It could maybe use some rubber textured grip to keep it from slipping in the hand and the thumb side could be a little more ergonomically shaped, but overall it’s pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: csan1

customer_reviews.title: Good, but poor ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable resistance has a good range and overall this is a decent trainer. My issue with it is the fit. The back side of the grip is curved away from your palm which makes for a very uncomfortable grip when doing higher weight. I end up getting very sore (not in a working out my muscles sort of way) and end up only using it for shorter workouts. It would be better if the grip was straight, or even better if it curved back toward the palm to match the natural curve of a hand.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Wagner

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, I've been using it for 5 or 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, I've been using it for 5 or 6 months and have noticed a big difference in my grip strength. Was looking at the Captains of Crush grippers because they are so highly recommended but settled on this since I wasn't sure what strength to purchase and this is adjustable. It's nice to be able to start easy if you've never done much grip training, and then adjust it over time instead of buying new grippers.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for grip development
customer_reviews.text: I have this, as well as a CoC 1 and 2. At the highest setting on this, it's somewhere in between those two, but the best part about this product is the adjustability. You can really set it to be the perfect difficulty for whatever rep range you are training. Personally I think the surface of the handles is a little too slick, and I prefer the aggressive texture on the CoC grippers. Plus, there is a bit of flex in the handles (just a little) at heavier settings. Honestly for what I was looking for, it would be 5 stars if it were more aggressively stippled on both the backstrap as well as in the finger grooves.
customer_reviews.author: P. Scoles

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip Trainer
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a few grip trainers from amazon and this one is my favorite. The range of adjustment is great. I can set it to be a really good challenge for me. Construction seems very solid. The one thing I would improve is give the handles some texture. The handles tended to slip in my grasp, but I added some athletic tape to the handles and it solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Colby B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and smooth!
customer_reviews.text: I used this one day so far, but I am very impressed with the quality. I am trying to improve grip strength for obstacle course races and already have pretty strong grip, I think, but this gave quite a workout on the lowest tension. As long as stability of the home hold up over time, which it feels like it will, I would absolutely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Max E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but needs some foam
customer_reviews.text: Nice range of resistance and appears to be well built. If your hands run average to small you'll want to add some foam or cushion to keep a more secure grip and make use more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JRausta

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my Mummy Fit Grip Strengthener and Adjustable Hand Exerciser. It's very well built. I particularly like the adjustability of the tension level. I highly recommend this grip strengthener!
customer_reviews.author: Droneman2018

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Strong, and ready to use right away.
customer_reviews.text: I received this Feb 1st and have been using is as instructed (Split the cardboard and their are exercise suggestions). This is a very well built product. One of the main reasons I purchased this is because the product generates the tension by compressing the spring rather than stretching it. I own ones that stretch the spring and I always had a fear in my mind that the spring would snap and possibly hurt me. I didn't rate it 5 starts because it gets slippery when you sweat and it begins to slip. In the next development, I would like to see a grip worked into the plastic handles. It's so minor though I give it a 4.5.
customer_reviews.author: cantslowdown

customer_reviews.title: Good solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid piece of equipment and this along with a finger strength builder work well together to build overall hand strength. It does have a good range of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Malone

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners. If you've used Captains of Crush, it may seem a little too easy.
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners. If you like Captains of Crush, this is a good stepping stone into their grip strength tools. Great for climbing and forearm endurance.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Campbell

customer_reviews.title: This product is very well built unfortunately it is too ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is very well built unfortunately it is too strong for me. At the lowest setting I can barely get my hands to span the opening much less close it. It works well I am not strong enough to operate it much less hold it closed.
customer_reviews.author: yvonne c pollien

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: Adjustability is great from beginner to extreme muscle god! Looks a bit cheap material wise but seems to function function well enough in comparison to other versions I’ve used w similar adjusting resistances.
customer_reviews.author: Ereq

customer_reviews.title: This is "the one" of grippers
customer_reviews.text: This is the best gripper I've found, it seems durable and has a capacity for high resistance (88lbs isnt enough), is ergonomic, (unlike captains of crush) and has a quiet and smooth action (unlike the gd ultra 70). It is pricey but I think worth it although I havent had it long enough to really test its durability. I came back to get another one for work I see though that it says it is no longer available :(
customer_reviews.author: djbollman

customer_reviews.title: Great way to build grip strength!!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this so far. Easy to adjust the settings for a great workout. To echo what others have said, this thing is VERY quiet - you can use it without distracting others in the room. I have only been using it for a short time, but I am already seeing results.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Like these
customer_reviews.text: Trying to improve my grip strength. Like the adjustment wheel on these as it can be turned for fine adjustment ( slight increase in resistance) and that resistance stays there till you adjust it again. So far very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Isenburg

customer_reviews.title: One size fits (most) grip needs
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to improve my pull up performance after feeling my hands always cramp with hanging. This is perfect for that goal. High quality spring that makes no noise, durable and comfortable plastic body/shell and easy to use. A perfect device for training grip properly and progressively. Sure COC products are the gold standard, but for most people, this product will more than meet their needs.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Weldon-Linne

customer_reviews.title: Better range of grip strength and more durable than other options
customer_reviews.text: The feel is solid, and thus I sense this won’t break like my prior grip strength trainers. And it has a wide ranger of grip resistance so I don’t have to start near the max as I’ve done with others.
customer_reviews.author: MITLV

customer_reviews.title: Lean mean crunching machine
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. You won't need another piece of hand training equipment after you purchase this one. At the middle setting, I can barely do 10 series with my dominant hand and I'm considered a VERY strong person (at least according to my 8-yr old niece). At the highest setting you will probably be able to crush walnuts with your bare hands. Now if that doesn't impress women I don't know what will. Come to think of it, there's always the beer can flattening on the forehead trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Max

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.  Will not last long.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, the resistance dial did not easily adjust, but I got used to it and was satisfied with product for 3 weeks... until the resistance mechanism broke. I reached out to seller. They replied once to say they'll replace it, but I have heard nothing more for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Vladislav Agureyev

customer_reviews.title: spring displacement on first day of use
customer_reviews.text: Man, this thing looks and feels solid. Love the grip and resistance. But the spring mechanism slipped the first day of use. I was able to shimmy it back in place, but it soon broke again.
customer_reviews.author: maf

customer_reviews.title: great gripper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. Hes a really big guy who is an avid weightlifter. I was worried it would be too easy for him but it wasn't. He uses it regularly and claims it has done wonders for his dead lift.
customer_reviews.author: hellos

customer_reviews.title: Watch tv and get Stronger hands
customer_reviews.text: I like this guy but I am ether very strong or this is not heavy enough. This is the best of the three I bought on amazon. Good way of strengthening hands.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. I had an issue understanding how to understand what resistance level I had the gripper set at and contacted Mummyfit customer service. They responded within an hour an provided me with clear directions. I look forward to using the gripper for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: herbert vargas

customer_reviews.title: The MummyFit is a MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: The MummyFit Grip is superior to the other dial-type hand strengthening products. It’s maximum tension is far beyond that of any other similar device I’ve used. I’m a senior golfer and I know my hand strength isn’t what it once was. This device has already increased that and given me more confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Miller

customer_reviews.title: Gripper is holding up great after significant use
customer_reviews.text: Gripper is holding up great after significant use. The range of motion could probably stand to be a bit more, but it works well for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! I popped a ligament in my pinky ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I popped a ligament in my pinky in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu class and had to wear a splint for a few months. I lost a significant amount of grip strength as a result. Using this gripper I have seen a significant increase in my grip strength. As my grip gets stronger, I love the fact that I am able to increase the resistance. Hopefully I will soon have the same grip strength I once had (or close) with continual use of this product.
customer_reviews.author: ThugJitsu

customer_reviews.title: Well built, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It's a good design. I have smaller hands and it is just a bit on the large side for me. Probably runs small if you have big hands.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Track Me

customer_reviews.title: Versrong spring
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, if you can crank this thing all the way up and still compress it all the way, you are truly He-Man, Master of the Universe.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: Durable, high quality build
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality grip trainer. I bought this when I lost my gold gym adjustable grip trainer. I like the whole compression design vs the spring. This is a durable trainer made of high quality material and it feels like it when you grasp it. For $25, this is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: I've only used them three weeks, I keep the ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used them three weeks , I keep the adjustment on lowest setting because my hand strength is weak . I find the front grips difficult to grasp when using durining my first set of exercise but seems to moderate as my hands adjust when warming up after a couple sets . I purchased the hand strengther because I was looker for durability and quality that would last , need more time for testing .
customer_reviews.author: Cyclerunner

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a whim for my step son for Christmas. He is 18 years old and very into working out. He loved it! We were all very impressed with the strength and quality. It has a wide range of adjustment, which means he’ll be working with this for a long time. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Strong Handshake!!
customer_reviews.text: This Grip strengthener fits well in my hand and can be adjusted to many desired resistance levels
customer_reviews.author: P. DAVIE

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy and might be worth your money
customer_reviews.text: Looks sturdy than the cheap ones out there. Hope this will really last long. I don't want to waste money on the cheap kind anymore. Let's see as I've only been using this for a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ro Yanis

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to see all the veins in your forearms
customer_reviews.text: It works. Follow the instructions you get via e-mail, and use it. Bought it more as a toy to play with when I'm watching TV instead of being a productive adult, but it turns out it's the real deal. Didn't expect to have such a noticeable difference so quickly. And yes, it's a bit expensive - but it turned out to be a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason T.

customer_reviews.title: Lack of handle grip
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 5 due to the grip handle being difficult to use and produce torque once moisture/lotion/oils are introduced. The grip handles sold separately should be included for FREE not $10 extra. 154lbs at the tension angle feels more like 300lbs. All-in-all, 4 months used to train, and has tremendously helped grip strength. Now able to clean olympic bar + weights comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Angel J Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: More expensive than the “knock off” but a better product. I bought 2 of the cheaper versions and they are just that-cheaper quality. Next time I will buy another Mummy Grip.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: So far very glad I bought this instead of set of expensive non-adjustable ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. So far very glad I bought this instead of set of expensive non-adjustable ones. Maybe if you were buying one of the sets for a professional gym where other people were going to be using and adding wear and tear to them would those make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for several month but then the rotating strength metal feel out, and I can’t get it back on, so it’s useless.
customer_reviews.author: TexasInvasion

customer_reviews.title: This baby is tougher than you
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had a strong grip until I came across this device. The only shortcoming I find is that the grip handles are too short. Longer would be better if you have big hands like me.
customer_reviews.author: Dissatisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my brother whom is blind abd has used hand grips for 20+ years, soon as this obe was delivered he opened it and knew right off that this was one of the best he's had, easy to use even for him.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Blalock

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable system
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to help strengthen his grip for bouldering. He seems to like it a lot and uses it 5 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hooten

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This thing can be as difficult as I need it to be. I'm not the strongest guy in the world, but I'm far from the weakest and I only have this at about 1/2 max level. My only very minor issue is that I kind of think I would like it to have a slightly longer travel, which I think happens as the tension is increased. But that is a very minor issue, and it works very well and is quite comfy.
customer_reviews.author: D.Ayotte

customer_reviews.title: First the handle is molded to fit your hand better than the other products of this type i have ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me say, I have had a few grip strengthener's in the past. This one is a cut Above. First the handle is molded to fit your hand better than the other products of this type i have used. Also the ability to adjust the resistance is a very good feature. You can really see your progress. In my opinion this gripper is worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: First impressions tell me it was well made, and built for some abuse. Hopefully it holds up to my expectations. If it doesn't I will let ya'll know. for now, I would definitely recommend it to a friend lol

customer_reviews.title: Not for Weak Hands
customer_reviews.text: I am using the lowest setting and I can do 25 reps before changing hands. The grips feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well-built; great strengthener for hands and wrist
customer_reviews.text: Great strengthener for the hand and wrist. Tension is very easy to adjust and also very ergonomic. Highly recommend and I'm not expert, but it seems to be very well made so worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Drunkfrombud90

customer_reviews.title: An Upgraded Fidget Spinner
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this actively for the past few weeks and I have to admit, I've started taking it everywhere. I use it regularly throughout the day at the office without a sound and take it with me anytime I'd usually have inactive hands. Seriously a great product if you're interested in fitness to any degree.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip strengthener!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice grip strengthener goes from 55 to 155 pounds I have not got there yet LOL. Seems to be very well-built they say it's made from Thermo plastic and nylon when you squeeze it does not flex or bend or anything seems very solid! Might buy another one so I can work out both hands at the same time. I also like the mummy and grim reaper logos but that's just me lol.
customer_reviews.author: George R

customer_reviews.title: Well made, a bit too intense
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely a solid piece of equipment. Should last a very long time. However, this is not for beginners. I'm in my 50's and I have to keep it in the lowest setting. I would have preferred something a little less intense. I'm using it to build hand strength for my archery bow and this is a little too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!!! I love this because it saves you lot of money because it gives you a variety of resistance levels instead of having to buy several different ones as you get stronger. I just wish they had one that would go up to a much higher resistance level. Now I am having to buy the individual Captains of Crush Hand Gripper grippers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark of Health

customer_reviews.title: but I did like their non-slip rubber grips alot better
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems to be a quality grip and for the price it should be..! I would have given it 5 STARS but I find that without the rubber molded into the grips it slips alot in my hand...especially when sweating. I have owned a couple of the cheaper hand grips...the kind with the squeaky springs...but I did like their non-slip rubber grips alot better.
customer_reviews.author: Wood Artist

customer_reviews.title: Poor range of motion.
customer_reviews.text: Felt cheap and had poor range of motion. I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it, love it
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best grip tools I've tried, and I've been through almost everything REI has. Much better than the traditional grip tools, perfect width for my hand and the adjustment is a huge value adder. Well worth the price. Solid, well made, smooth. Just wish their website worked so I could order more of their products. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Drew D. Mccan

customer_reviews.title: Silver back gorilla forarms
customer_reviews.text: Very good and sturdy product!! The spring looks heavy duty and thick gauged spring. Wish it came with the grippers for comfort for the price but overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald lucero

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It's Good product but little bit hard to hold on hand .
customer_reviews.author: Maxie

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great, this is the Cadillac of hand strength tools. I useevery day on the train when I commute. Tool is very quite and an adjust the power levels as I want. Well worth the price. This tool is something that I am sure can be passed on to my grandkids. Plus the makers of the product are great and take great pride in what they sell
customer_reviews.author: Tuco

customer_reviews.title: It’s only okay?!?
customer_reviews.text: When I squeeze it together, the handles don’t line up.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. It's solidly constructed and comfortable to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It's solidly constructed and comfortable to use (as comfortable as a piece of exercise equipment needs to be, anyway). I have smaller than average hands for an adult male, but have no problems with this device. The resistance indicator is a bit hard to see through the spring, but precision is not critical here - as long as the resistance keeps increasing, it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: FY

customer_reviews.title: This is very nice I like it
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I've been looking for works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Waldemar

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Very happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very happy with the results. Have been using for 20 months. No sign of wear or tear.
customer_reviews.author: MAX808

customer_reviews.title: Very strong units
customer_reviews.text: These are very strong units, and it would take a gorilla to compress them at max level.
customer_reviews.author: Michael central Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this item for when I am waiting for things to load on the computer at work. Has helped my hand strength greatly. I recommend it even to de-stress while at work. Better than a stress ball!
customer_reviews.author: Gunny D

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I dig how this is put together. Easy to use, works well.
customer_reviews.author: BillEck

customer_reviews.title: Totally impressed with the impressively made death grip. I've ...
customer_reviews.text: Totally impressed with the impressively made death grip. I've tried others and none are built as durable as this device. I've broken others . The death grip is quality, durable , serious hand strengthening equipment that you can feel from the moment you open the package. . . the moment you put it in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: marleaux

product_meta.title: MummyFit Grip Strengthener and Adjustable Hand Trainer. Best Grippers for Forearm and Finger Strength. Gripper Provides 55-154 lbs of Crush Resistance. Unfold Packaging to Reveal Your Bonus Workout.
product_meta.description:
ONE GRIP STRENGTHENER TO RULE THEM ALL

Introducing the most versatile, durable and effective grip and hand strengthener ever created.

SILENT - Our solid steel compression spring is designed to be completely silent when compressed. You'll never have to worry about the squeaky sound that plagues other grippers. You could train with your Death Grip next to a sleeping baby, and they would never even know you were there.

VERSATILE - With a resistance range of 55-154 lbs (25-70 kg), the Death Grip gripper can offer a level of resistance that can challenge both beginners and veterans alike. Regardless of your current grip strength, you will find levels of resistance that will allow you to see dramatic improvement while challenging you every step of the way.

QUALITY - Crafted 100% from Thermoplastic Nylon and Steel, you can feel the quality the instant you pick up the Death Grip grip strengthener. There is no squeaky spring, no side to side wobble and the resistance only adjusts when you want it to. If you're looking for a gripper that you can use and then hand down to the next generation, this is it.

SAFE - By using a compression spring design, we've eliminated the danger posed by adjustable grippers that create resistance by stretching a metal spring. Stretching a spring places a tremendous amount of tension on the spring and the anchors holding it in place. When that much force & potential energy is placed on weak metal & plastic components, they will eventually fail, sending dangerous debris flying through the air.

100% Money Back Guarantee - We are confident that you will LOVE your MummyFit Death Grip gripper. However, if you buy our grip strengthener & don't like it for any reason, we'll refund 100% of your money. It's that simple.

Be sure you get the very best and click the add to cart button right now!
feature_bullets: SILENT! The ultimate workout machine for men and women on the go. Do your exercises anytime and anywhere because the Death Grip's completely silent operation allows you to strengthen your hand grip and exercise your forearms and wrist without detection. Since your Death Grip gripper is light enough to bring anywhere and doesn't make annoying squeaking noises that most grippers make, you can use your exerciser at work, on a plane or even in a library without bothering those around you.

INDESTRUCTIBLE! Crafted entirely from thermoplastic nylon and steel, this grip strengthener is built like a tank. Even the adjustment wheel is solid steel. You can strengthen your hands every day for years to come and still be able to pass your Death Grip down to the next generation. You simply won't find a higher quality adjustable gripper anywhere. We're so confident in the quality of our equipment that we offer a LIFETIME WARRANTY that covers any problems resulting from normal, proper use.

ADJUSTABLE! When you lift weights, do you use the same amount of weight every day, or do you adjust the weight up or down based on your workout needs? Why should using a grip strengthener be any different? With the Death Grip adjustable gripper, you can start at the level of resistance that's right for you and increase the resistance as your grip strength improves. Don't limit your progress by using the same level of resistance day in and day out. Welcome to the future of grippers.

SAFE! Focus on strengthening your grips without worrying about accidents. The resistance of the Death Grip is generated by COMPRESSING a solid steel spring. Other adjustable grippers create resistance by STRETCHING the spring, which can be dangerous. Stretching a spring places extreme tension on the components holding the spring in place. These components often fail, resulting in dangerous flying debris and metal shrapnel. By compressing the spring, we've eliminated this risk altogether.

BIG SAVINGS! In order to match the 55-154 lbs range of resistance offered by the Death Grip, you would need to purchase SIX of the leading metal coil grippers. Why buy SIX expensive grippers when you can have the same levels of resistance all in ONE grip strengthener? Better yet, you'll save 75% and end up with a higher-quality tool that is more convenient and more comfortable to use. This is one of those rare moments when you can spend WAY less and get SO much more in return.
